data.title: Are there full game consoles, classic retro games, like in previous AC games?
data.meta_description: For Animal Crossing: New Horizons on the Nintendo Switch, a GameFAQs message board topic titled "Are there full game consoles, classic retro games, like in previous AC games?".
data.text:
mbowsher76 4 years ago#1

In old AC games (I am thinking of Wii or Gamecube) you could find old NES consoles and with each one you could play a classic game (Punch Out, etc). Will something like that be in the game?

pokedude900 4 years ago#2

The original Animal Crossing was the only one that had these. They will never do it again because Nintendo wants you to buy from the Virtual Console/subscribe to Nintendo Online.

https://i.imgur.com/lfI7zGE.jpg https://i.imgur.com/tgLNUuX.jpg

Come to the (un)official GameFAQs Touhou board. http://www.gamefaqs.com/boards/1110-

mbowsher76 (Topic Creator)4 years ago#3

Well that is dumb

#4

(message deleted)

Touhou 4 years ago#5

IIRC, aside from Punch Out, none of the games were that special or fun, anyway. They really did act like mini-games.

Finally. A topic I claimed 500. https://gamefaqs.gamespot.com/boards/234547-super-smash-bros-ultimate/79727215

Youmu, Yuuka, and Doremy are my favorite Touhous.

Major_Marth 4 years ago#6

Touhou posted...

IIRC, aside from Punch Out, none of the games were that special or fun, anyway. They really did act like mini-games.

I always thought they were the full games. I remember being able to make decent progress in LoZ and Super Mario Bros.

my romantic side wanted a miracle boner, followed by a miracle recovery followed by stripper wedding Abnormal Ernie

pokedude900 4 years ago#7

They are the full games. He just means they felt like minigames because most of them were 1st generation NES games like Excite Bike and Balloon Fight. But then you've got some amazing ones like Wario's Woods.

LoZ and SMB weren't available without hacking, btw.

https://i.imgur.com/lfI7zGE.jpg https://i.imgur.com/tgLNUuX.jpg

Come to the (un)official GameFAQs Touhou board. http://www.gamefaqs.com/boards/1110-

PkmTrainerAbram 4 years ago#8

New Leaf had a Planet Puzzle League and rpg-lite minigames, so, yeah, it wasn't just need ROMs.

It certainly can't hurt to patch these types of things in.

https://www.instagram.com/abramj.broomiii/

https://twitter.com/AbramJBroomIII
